message.content:
cs.CL, cs.AI, cs.LG, cs.IR, cs.NE. 

The paper deals with natural language processing and semantic parsing, which are core topics in the field of computational linguistics (cs.CL). The use of latent-variable probabilistic context-free grammars (PCFGs) is a common technique in machine learning and artificial intelligence (cs.AI), and the paper proposes a novel grammar model for paraphrase generation using PCFGs. The evaluation of the proposed method involves improving the performance of a semantic parser, which is a task related to machine learning and natural language processing (cs.LG). The paper also deals with information retrieval, as it aims to bridge the gap between natural language questions and knowledge base entries (cs.IR). Finally, the use of probabilistic models and sampling techniques is a common approach in neural networks and optimization algorithms, which are topics in the field of neural engineering (cs.NE).
